department: Department of Biochemical Engineering and Biotechnology
name: BBL133 Mass and Energy Balances in Biochemical Engineering
description: Stoichiometric relations and yield concepts, Maintenance coefficient, Mass balance based on available electron concept; Units and dimensions, Fundamentals of material balance, Balance on unit processes and reactive systems, Behaviour of ideal and real gases, vapour pressure, humidity and saturation. Energy balance, Heat capacity of gases, liquid and solids, Latent heat, Heat of reaction, formation and combustion, solution and dilution. Energy balance of reactive and non-reactive processes. Unsteady state material and energy balance in bioprocess. Case studies.
